New Records: New York are the first team since 1970 to extend a World Series to a fifth game when down three games to none.
Key Match Events: Anthony Volpe hits a grand slam against the Dodgers in the third inning.
Gleyber Torres hits a three-run home run in the bottom of the eighth inning.
Austin Wells hits a home run in the bottom of the sixth inning.
Aaron Judge hits an RBI single in the bottom of the eighth inning.
Luke Weaver strikes out Mookie Betts to end the seventh inning.
Pre-Game Insights: The goal of LA was to get through a bullpen game without using their big bullpen pieces.
New York will have their ace Gerrit Cole on the hill for Game 5.
The Dodgers will have Jack Flaherty starting in Game 5.
Post-Match Reflections: The Yankees stave off elimination with Game 4 win.
The Yankees' bats awakened for Game 4 win over Dodgers.
Even Judge looked a bit better tonight.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Fan ejected for prying ball out of Betts’ glove.
Yankees running amok in the eighth inning.
